intro: Scorzoneroides × hugueninii, commonly known as the hybrid evening primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure with four petals and stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open prairies and disturbed areas. Its seeds are encased in a hard capsule, which disperses when dry and brittle.
